iso_birth.definition: Isomorphic patterns in birth and emergence across scales capture structural equivalences in creative hierarchiesâ€”mappings where formations, developments, and independences preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical emergences, pattern replications, and self-organizing births, validated via systems theory (e.g., phase-structural patterns per web:8) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., quantum to cognitive emergence per web:3). Hard-to-vary invariants like fractal recursions enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm emergence/deny reductionism/both in hierarchies/neither in platonic spaces); scores >0.98 based on 2025 abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and emergent overlays (e.g., particle birth to AI deployment).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., cosmic birth links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., hierarchical birth); integrate diachronic depth (primordial emergence to 2025 AI births).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Implicational: if precursors integrate, then entity emerges)

properties.principle: string (hard-to-vary invariant, e.g., Recursive formation toward independence)

data.description: Nested formations leading to entity independence mapping invariantly.

examples.universality: Implicational: if precursors integrate, then entity emerges

data.description: Detachment from origin; separations map invariantly (e.g., birth canal to independence declarations).

tetralemmas: Affirm emergence/deny reductionism/both in hierarchies/neither in platonic spaces.
